data.title: Peds Residents
data.text:
Hometown

Cary, NC

Undergraduate

Davidson College

Medical School

University of South Carolina – Greenville

Career/Clinical Interests

Gender Affirming Care/LGBTQ+ Care

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

I was blown away by the range of interests and passions of each and every person I met at UAB. The people were absolutely incredible and so were the ways they took care of and invested in their patients. There are so many unique opportunities for community engagement and so many brilliant patient advocates and change makers. I wanted to be part of a program that would provide a multitude of opportunities for advocacy work in clinical, community, and legislative spaces, and UAB had it all!

Hobbies/Special Interests

Reading (thrillers, mystery), cooking, piano, trying new coffee shops!

Fun Fact

I used to be a competitive slam poet!

Hometown

Belmont, NC / Lafayette, LA

Undergraduate

University of Louisiana at Monroe

Medical School

Louisiana State University - Shreveport

Career/Clinical Interests

Currently keeping my mind open, but I’ve always been interested in Academic Medicine and possibly Combined Heme/Onc!

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

I loved how close-knit this program was and how evident it was even through a computer screen. I wanted to be at a place where I felt supported not only by my fellow residents, but by leadership as well. I was blown away during my interview and second look because I could tell that the leadership was very supportive of their residents’ wellness, and of their personal and professional goals. The categorical programs are very strong, and I knew training here would make me both a great internist and pediatrician. The beautiful city of Birmingham is just a plus to all this program has to offer!

Hobbies/Special Interests

Reading, Painting, Crochet, Nail Art.

Fun Fact

I was in an arts academy in high school for painting and graphic design- and I still love doing artsy things! These days, you’ll find me working on multiple crochet projects and making nail art. I even started my personal nail shop/service during my last year of medical school!

Hometown

Birmingham, AL

Undergraduate

Howard University

Medical School

Howard University College of Medicine

Career/Clinical Interests

Not sure just yet, I love working with kids, adults and solving complex problems.

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

I want to be an excellent physician and I knew I would receive excellent training here. The best part is I am lucky enough to be trained in the city that I am from and serve my hometown community

Hobbies/Special Interests

My family, romance novels, and eating great food.

Fun Fact

I love sneakers!

Hometown

Hoover, AL

Undergraudate

Auburn University

Medical School

University of Alabama at Birmingham

Career/Clinical Interests

Transition of Care in Medically Complex Children Becoming Adults (general vs subspecialty).

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

I looked ALL over for residency and found great Med-Peds programs everywhere, but there is truly something special about UAB and this community I never found replicated. Some of it lies in the combination of balanced training with exceptional categorical programs on each side in a physically connected hospital system that facilitates Med-Peds unity even in a big system. Some of it is the catchment area and mix of tertiary/quaternary care with care of the underserved all in the same place. Some of it is the emphasis on teaching and learning at all levels and creating psychologically safe learning environments. But most of it is feeling like I was already so embraced and loved by a community I simply could not imagine leaving! So thankful I get to be part of the UAB MedPeds family!

Hobbies/Special Interests

Tennis, mountain biking, running, church/college ministry, game nights with friends, coffee shops, Broadway (sibling trips to NYC), Disney!

Fun Fact

My father and I are trying to see a game at every major league baseball stadium together.

Hometown

Paris, KY

Undergraduate

Transylvania University

Medical School

University of Kentucky

Career/Clinical Interests

Med-Peds primary care and maybe inpatient adult medicine, but keeping my options open!

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

True connections that I made during my interview and how genuine everyone was. I knew I would be able to call Birmingham home because the people, not just because of the awesome city! Having never seen UAB before I had interviewed, my expectations could never have prepared me for how incredible the program directors, residents, and support staff would be.

Hobbies/Special Interests

Tennis, ultimate frisbee, running, meeting new people, trying new restaurants, especially in Birmingham, craft beer

Fun Fact

I was born on October 3rd, which, if anyone cares to know, is Mean Girls Day. And no, I don’t wear pink on Wednesdays!

Hometown

Brinson, Georgia

Undergraduate

Georgia Institute of Technology

Medical School

Mercer University School of Medicine

Career/Clinical Interests

Breastfeeding medicine, rural health, advocacy for incarcerated people, primary care

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

The people here are just the best! From my very first interactions, I immediately connected with residents and faculty in Med-Peds, Medicine, and Pediatrics. Additionally, the patient population here is similar to where I hope to practice and the culture at UAB is one which truly supports and encourages resident well being.

Hobbies/Special Interests

Hiking (locally, love Oak Mountain with my husband and two kids!), currently on a quest to find the best pizza in Birmingham, cycling, reading (fav: The Sun Still Shines), and baking.

Fun Fact

I once sang the National Anthem at an Atlanta Braves game and before a sitting US President.

Hometown

Huntsville, Al

Undergraduate

Auburn University

Medical School

Heersink School of Medicine

Career/Clinical Interests

Combined hospitalists, academic medicine

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

I chose UAB Med-Peds because of the strong balance of medicine and pediatrics. The people here are always eager to teach and invest in learners of all stages. Going to medical school here I was able to see how the faculty is invested in their resident and cares about their growth both inside and outside of work.

Hobbies/Special Interests

Spending time with my dog, Harper. Reading mystery/thriller novels, catching up with friends at local breweries around Birmingham.

Fun Fact

I am a triplet! I have two sisters, once is a pharmacists and the other an engineer.

Hometown

Jackson, TN

Undergraduate

Lipscomb University

Medical School

East Tennessee State University

Career/Clinical Interests

Med-Peds Primary Care. I would love to care for largely underserved populations. I'm passionate about global health and forming sustainable partnerships with other physicians, hospitals, and clinics in different areas around the world. I'm also very interested in the study of infectious disease!

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

I love the culture at UAB. I knew that I would have the opportunity to learn from top-notch clinicians on both the IM and Peds side. The leadership of the Med-Peds program and both of the categorical programs truly care about our development as people with lives outside of the hospital, too!

Hobbies/Special Interests

Reading (theology/philosophy/history), Sports, Music/Concerts, Outdoors Activities (hiking, skiing, tennis)

Fun Fact

I used to work at a deli in Nashville and cooked for country music stars Tim McGraw, Faith Hill, and others. Sandwiches are still the only thing that I can cook -- but they are pretty good if I must say so myself.

Hometown

Tracy, CA and Huntsville, AL

Undergraduate

University of Alabama at Birmingham

Graduate School

UAB School of Public Health

Medical School

Heersink School of Medicine

Career/Clinical Interests

Academic Primary Care/Transition Medicine/Precision Medicine Research

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

The people! Additionally, Children's Hospital of Alabama is the only children's hospital in the state, providing a very large catchment area and allowing us to see not only bread and butter peds, but also rare and complex cases. As an aspiring researcher, UAB not only has robust research opportunities and world-renowned research faculty, but also an inter-disciplinary culture well-known to support early career trainees.

Hobbies/Special Interests

Yoga, running, D&D, gardening, hanging out with my fiance Jon and our dog Roux

Fun Fact

I just bought a house!

Hometown

St. Louis, MO

Undergraduate

University of Missouri - Kansas City

Medical School

University of Missouri - Kansas City

Career/Clinical Interests

Academic Med-Peds Hospitalist with involvement in Medical Education

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

The people here are fabulous! They are invested in your personal success both in and outside of the hospital. Moving from another state, I couldn’t be more appreciative to have made a new family here with the wonderful people at UAB. It was important to me to train at a Med-Peds program that offered equally strong training on both sides. UAB has the perfect mix of local engagement as well as a national reputation for excellence in medicine.

Hobbies/Special Interests

Cooking, baking, running, game nights with friends, Peloton, exploring BHAM!

Fun Fact

My husband is an oral surgery resident at UAB and we've both inadvertently started saying "y'all" since moving down here!

Hometown

Hoover, AL

Undergraduate

Auburn University

Medical School

Heersink School of Medicine

Career/Clinical Interests

Adolescent medicine, transitional care, some form of inpatient and outpatient (all the things)

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

I was really fortunate and lucky to have been able to work with a lot of the MedPeds residents as a medical student; they were half the reason why I decided to go into MedPeds! I chose to stay at UAB for the residents, the leadership, and the incredibly strong categorical programs on either side!

What do you love about UAB Med-Peds?

Everyone here is just incredibly supportive of one another and down to earth. On my first day of residency, almost every resident reached out to us and offered support and encouragement. I also love that Dr. Stein set such a welcoming and warm atmosphere for us - I know that her door truly is always open, day or night.

Birmingham's Best Food and/or Drink

Big Spoon Ice Cream!!! I’m torn on drinks because I love all of the breweries: Trimtab, Backforty, and Carrigans Beer Garden are my favorites

Birmingham Must-See

Legion FC Soccer Game!

Hometown

Waterproof, LA/Natchez, MS

Undergraduate

Louisiana State University

Graduate School

Georgia State University College of Law

Medical School

Heersink School of Medicine

Career/Clinical Interests

Primary care, prison healthcare reform and medico-legal consulting.

Why did you choose UAB Med-Peds Residency Program?

Some of my most memorable upper levels were Med-Peds residents. Other than the fantastic training, I was truly interested in a program that was open and willing to have honest conversations about increasing diversity and minority representation within their program. I also had a really fun virtual interview day!

What do you love about UAB Med-Peds?

This program leadership has been phenomenal. They reached out to offer honest advice early on in 4th year and that advice has only increased since then. For every good and bad experience, I know that if I hear from no one else, I am going to hear from my PDs, APDs and Chief. I think I talk to/text with my PD every single day. Is that weird? That might be weird. You don't have to put this part if it's weird.

Birmingham's Best Food and/or Drink

Chez FonFon if you want to be fancy. Encore Rouge Food Truck if you aren't on any sort of diet. Big Bad Breakfast, ABE, FIVE or Over Easy if you are looking for brunch. Slice if you want a good low carb pizza.

Birmingham Must-See

Hmmm. Tough. I'm not really an outdoors, hiking, nature person so I'm probably not the best person to answer this questions. There's some monument, viking man thing that people talk about. Apparently people like the mountains around here. But, the Birmingham Civil Rights Institute is really nice.

Hometown

Huntsville, AL

Undergraduate

Auburn University

Medical School

Heersink School of Medicine

Career/Clinical Interests

Medical education, hospital medicine, infectious diseases

What do you love about UAB Med-Peds?

Since I had the privilege of being a medical student here at UAB, I was able to see that both the IM and Peds programs here truly display excellence without ego. Also, the Med-Peds residents were always my favorite to work with on the wards.

What are the strengths of UAB Med-Peds?

The support! The UAB Med-Peds family is no joke.

Birmingham's Best Food and/or Drink

Post Office Pies, Ono Poke, Back Forty, Soho Social, Blue Pacific, Seoul Restaurant

Birmingham Must-See

Hometown Supermarket! I know it’s strange to recommend a grocery store, but for those who love international cooking, this place is truly top notch. I could spend hours in there!
